This, chilli garlic sauce, adds distinctive and strong flavor to any dish. with amazing 14 images, A fabulous hot, chilli garlic sauce, of Chinese or Vietnamese origin., Indian style chilli garlic sauce, , , , For chilli garlic sauce, , To make, chilli garlic sauce, , remove the stems of the kashmiri red chillies and put them in enough hot water, cover with a lid and keep aside for 30 minutes. Drain., Combine the soaked kashmiri red chillies, garlic, sugar, vinegar and salt and blend in a mixer till smooth., Transfer the mixture into a deep bowl, add the sesame oil and mix well., Store the, chilli garlic sauce, in an air-tight container in the refrigerator and use as required., , , , , , , , , , , , , , chilli garlic sauce recipe | Indian style chilli garlic sauce | Video by Tarla Dalal, , , , , ×, , , , , , Chilli Garlic Sauce recipe with step by step photos, , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , Like chilli garlic sauce, , , , , , , , , If you like, chilli garlic sauce recipe | Indian style chilli garlic sauce | homemade chilli garlic sauce |, given below is the list to similar recipes :, , Chilli garlic chutney, |, | lahsun chutney | chilli garlic chutney for chaats | red garlic chutney | with 15 amazing images., , green garlic sauce for Chinese food, | green garlic sauce for Indian snacks | sweet and spicy green garlic sauce | Chinese green garlic sauce | with 10 amazing images., , Hot garlic sauce, |, Chinese style hot garlic sauce | Indian style hot garlic sauce | homemade hot garlic sauce | with 10 amazing images., , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , How to make chilli garlic sauce, , , , , , , , , To prepare, chilli garlic sauce recipe | Indian style chilli garlic sauce | homemade chilli garlic sauce |, , Chinese chilli garlic sauce |, remove the stems of the Kashmiri red chillies and discard., , , , , , Heat 1 cup of water in a saucepan and transfer to a deep bowl., , , , , , Put the chillies in water and cover with a lid and keep aside for 30 minutes. We have made use of Kashmiri red chillies which provides a fiery red colour and mild heat but, you can use any other variety or a combination of 1-2 dried red chillies depending upon the spice level you can handle. Also, we have not removed the seeds of the chillies but if you want a more smooth chilli garlic sauce and less spicy, you can remove the seeds of the chillies before putting them in water. Fresh chillies like Thai bird-eye or cayennes, red jalapenos or Fresno peppers can also be used if available., , , , , , After half an hour, drain the chillies using a strainer and discard the water. Soaking softens the red chillies and helps in blending easily., , , , , , To make chilli garlic sauce, transfer the soaked and drained chillies to a mixer jar., , , , , , Add chopped garlic. Smash the garlic with the back of a knife to quickly remove the skin or soak the garlic cloves in hot water for a while, as it makes them easier to peel. Also, oil your hands to avoid the garlicky aroma lingering on your fingertips., , , , , , Add sugar. It counteracts vinegar and neutralizes the flavour of spicy chilli garlic sauce., , , , , , Add white vinegar. It acts as a preservative and increases the shelf life of chilli garlic sauce. The acid helps cut through spiciness and contributes to the sourish taste of chilli garlic sauce. You can replace vinegar with lemon juice., , , , , , Add salt., , , , , , Blend till smooth into a fine paste without using any water., , , , , , Transfer chilli garlic sauce in a bowl., , , , , , Add the sesame oil. It enhances the flavor and gives a beautiful aroma to our homemade chilli garlic sauce., , , , , , Mix well and our, chilli garlic sauce | Indian style chilli garlic sauce | homemade chilli garlic sauce |, , Chinese chilli garlic sauce |, is ready., , , , , , Store, spicy chilli garlic sauce, in an air-tight container in the refrigerator and use as required. Keep in mind to always use a clean and dry spoon to take out the chilli garlic sauce when needed as moisture may spoil its freshness., , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , Frequently Asked Questions, , , , , , , , , , , Q. Can this sauce be stored and used for long upto a month?, , Yes, you can store this sauce in a tight sealed jar for upto a month., , , , Q. What is the substitute for sesame oil?, You can use regular oil. We recommend sesame oil to get a nutty taste., , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , Nutrient values (Abbrv)per plate, , Nutrient values (Abbrv) per tbsp, Energy, 33 cal, Protein, 0 g, Carbohydrates, 1.6 g, Fiber, 0 g, Fat, 3 g, Cholesterol, 0 mg, Sodium, 0 mg, , , , , , , Click here to view, Calories for Chilli Garlic Sauce, , , The Nutrient info is complete, , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , Your Rating*, , , , , , ☆, , , ☆, , , ☆, , , ☆, , , ☆, , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , Submit Reviews, , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , Margaret Rosario, , March 13, 2025, midnight, , It was the simplicity of the steps involved that inspired me to prepare this absolutely delightful chilli garlic sauce. Recipe.Orange Stir Fry Sauce: Ingredients: since foods, are often processed at facilities that also process wheat and other grains., Recipes containing the V  icon are designed to be Vegan and contain no animal products. Please read product labels for each ingredient to ensure this to be the case., Recipes containing the VG icon are designed to be Lacto-Ovo vegetarian and contain no poultry, meat, or fish. Please read product labels for each ingredient to ensure this to be the case., ORANGE STIR-FRY SAUCE, SERVES: 8 (approx. 2 Tbsp. each)  Prep Time: 10 min.  Cooking Time: 28 min., CONTAINER EQUIVALENTS:, ½, Ever had Chinese orange chicken? It’s delicious, but sadly not Fix-approved—until now! Use this pre-made sauce to add that orange flavor, to any perfectly portioned bowl. You can portion it into a muffin pan, freeze, then store frozen sauce portions in a freezer bag for up to 3, months! Just cook up a batch and have it on hand for whenever you need to spice up your next quick meal., 1 Tbsp., rice vinegar, 2 Tbsp., coconut sugar, ¾ cup, low-sodium organic vegetable broth, ½ cup, 100% orange juice, 2 Tbsp., reduced-sodium tamari soy sauce, 1 Tbsp., orange marmalade, ½ tsp., garlic powder, ½ tsp., ground ginger, 1 pinch, ground cayenne pepper (optional), 1 Tbsp., cornstarch (preferably GMO-free) +, 1 Tbsp. water (combine to make, a slurry), ½ tsp., sesame oil, 1. 	 Heat vinegar and sugar in small saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring, to a gentle boil; gently boil, stirring constantly, for 1 to 2 minutes, or until, sugar caramelizes and forms a thick syrup., 2. 	 Add broth, orange juice, soy sauce, marmalade, garlic powder, ginger, and, cayenne pepper (if desired). Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low;, gently boil for 15 minutes to reduce sauce., 3. 	 Add cornstarch slurry. Whisk to blend; gently boil for 1 minute, or until, sauce thickens. Remove from heat., 4. 	 Add oil; mix well., RECIPE NOTE:, •	 You’re going to be tempted to skip the first step, but don’t overlook, its importance. Caramelizing the sugar and vinegar together raises the, temperature above the boiling point of the actual sauce. This drives off, the harsher flavor in the vinegar, leaving behind only a pleasant tang, while coaxing out deeper flavors from the sugar, and it makes all the, difference. Otherwise, you end up with a sauce that smells and tastes of, hot vinegar—yuck!, NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION (per serving): Calories: 38  Total Fat: 0 g  Saturated Fat: 0 g   Cholesterol: 0 mg  Sodium: 130 mg  Carbohydrates: 8 g  Fiber: 0 g, Sugars: 6 g  Protein: 0 g, RECIPES, © 2018 Beachbody, LLC.
